searchDocs.title: list_pets​
searchDocs.content: HTTP Method: GETEndpoint: /pets  Parameters  Name	Type	Required	Descriptionlimit	int	❌	How many items to return at one time (max 100)  Return Type  List[Pet]  Example Usage Code Snippet  from test_sdk import TestSdk, Environment sdk = TestSdk( access_token="YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN", base_url=Environment.DEFAULT.value ) result = sdk.pets.list_pets(limit=30) print(result)

searchDocs.title: create_pets​
searchDocs.content: HTTP Method: POSTEndpoint: /pets  Parameters  Name	Type	Required	Descriptionrequest_body	Pet	✅	The request body.  Example Usage Code Snippet  from test_sdk import TestSdk, Environment from test_sdk.models import Pet sdk = TestSdk( access_token="YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN", base_url=Environment.DEFAULT.value ) request_body = Pet( id_=1, name="name", tag="tag" ) result = sdk.pets.create_pets(request_body=request_body) print(result)

searchDocs.title: show_pet_by_id​
searchDocs.content: HTTP Method: GETEndpoint: /pets/{petId}  Parameters  Name	Type	Required	Descriptionpet_id	str	✅	The id of the pet to retrieve  Return Type  Pet  Example Usage Code Snippet  from test_sdk import TestSdk, Environment sdk = TestSdk( access_token="YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN", base_url=Environment.DEFAULT.value ) result = sdk.pets.show_pet_by_id(pet_id="petId") print(result)  Build your own SDKs with liblab Build developer friendly SDKs in minutes from your APIs Start for free →

searchDocs.title: Table of Contents​
searchDocs.content: Setup & Configuration Supported Language VersionsInstallation Authentication Access Token Authentication ServicesModelsLicense  Setup & Configuration

searchDocs.title: Supported Language Versions​
searchDocs.content: This SDK is compatible with the following versions: Python >= 3.7

searchDocs.title: Installation​
searchDocs.content: To get started with the SDK, we recommend installing using pip:  pip install test_sdk   Authentication

searchDocs.title: Access Token Authentication​
searchDocs.content: The TestSdk API uses an Access Token for authentication.  This token must be provided to authenticate your requests to the API.

searchDocs.title: Setting the Access Token​
searchDocs.content: When you initialize the SDK, you can set the access token as follows:  TestSdk( access_token="YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN" )   If you need to set or update the access token after initializing the SDK, you can use:  sdk.set_access_token("YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN")   Services  The SDK provides various services to interact with the API.  Below is a list of all available services with links to their detailed documentation: NamePetsService    Models  The SDK includes several models that represent the data structures used in API requests and responses. These models help in organizing and managing the data efficiently.  Below is a list of all available models with links to their detailed documentation: Name	DescriptionPet	    License  This SDK is licensed under the MIT License.
